com.betterit.kaligia.controller

Class SystemCalibrationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.betterit.kaligia.controller.SystemCalibrationController

  • @Controller
public class SystemCalibrationController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class hosts all functions related to Calibrations, both Operator side and Admin Factory Calibrations

      • SystemCalibrate

        @Transactional(rollbackFor=java.lang.Exception.class)
 @RequestMapping(value="/SystemCalibration",
                method=POST)
 @ResponseBody
public CalibrationProfile SystemCalibrate(@RequestParam(value="emitterId")
                                                                                                                                                                                             java.lang.String emitterId)
                                                                                                                                                                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Controller for Wavelength Calibration. This functions performs wavelength calibration, validates it and saves the calibration data in DB
        Parameters:
        emitterId - A Unique passed from Front end, that is also used to register a SseEmitter. This will be used to transmit messages to the front end.
        Returns:
        CalibrationProfile with Wavelength Calibration data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLastCalibration

        @RequestMapping(value="/getLastCalibration",
                method=GET)
 @ResponseBody
public java.lang.String[] getLastCalibration()
                                                                                                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the information of the last wavelength calibration done on the connected spectrometer
        Returns:
        a size 5 array with information about the last wavelength calibration, in the following order:
        0: A Human friendly text saying when the last calibration was performed 1: Last Calibration Date in the format MM/dd/yyyy 2: Last Calibration Time in the format h:mm:a 3: Human Readable format saying how long back ago the calibration was done durationToString(long) 4: Flag value. 1 if last calibration was done within the last 24 hours, 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
